intro: Spilanthes intermedia, commonly known as the common Indian mustards, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. Spilanthes intermedia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
